A sweet cantaloupe tea that fills your heart with its fragrant aroma and delightful sweetness.
Made with common beachcombing finds, this dish is already bursting with flavors given minimal seasoning.
A congee made with shellfish and wheat. The aroma of grain meets the sweetness of shellfish in perfect fusion.
It's not the kind of caterpillar you're thinking of, nor the kind of herb...
A pot of flavorful rice made by stewing various ingredients together.
A fruit pie made with snowy cantaloupe and wheat. Sweet, tangy, and very filling.
A tea brewed by Mobai using local ingredients. Hoho, with this pleasant sunshine, let's take our time and enjoy a cup of tea.
A dish made with sea urchin and crab. Due to its optimistic implication, it's also known as the "Land Ho! Special."
Just put all the pretty ingredients together. Taste?... Well, who cares when it looks this good!
One knife is all it takes to bring out the fish's true flavor.
A simple dish made from grains, where each morsel falls like soft clouds into your stomach.
A simple mix of fruits and veggies to keep you hydrated and give your body a natural vitamin boost.
A rare claypot stew, masterfully slow-simmered with a medley of precious ingredients.
Said to give you a great boost, this soup is fondly known in Hexia as "Full Sail Soup."
Tender meat filling wrapped in flower-like leafy vegetables. Crisp to the bite and bursting with flavorful juiciness.
An extraordinary seafood feast made from the rarest catches and fresh mushrooms â€” the ultimate celebration of beachcombing bounties.
A simple stir-fried vegetable dish that quickly restores your strength when you're tired.
The mushrooms and fresh fish in this dish bring out the best in each other.
The black crab clings tightly onto everything in front of it, even inside the cooking pot.
A delicious little cake made with fruit. It's a teatime staple.
A delicious, mouthwatering dish made with slow-cooked fish in tangy-sweet fruit stock.
A soft, delicious kabuto-shaped rice bun filled with sweet fruit filling.
Yunguo has eighty-one favorite ways of enjoying an apple, and this is only one of them!
A dish reminiscent of the night market's "BBQ Megasquid." It looks like meat and tastes like...
A simple dish made with fish and seafood. It's as invigorating as the sea breeze!
A simple vegetable congee that comforts the heart like a gentle countryside breeze.
This sweet and sour fruit rice bowl is incredibly appetizing, even on the hottest of days.
When the ingredients themselves are already premium delicacies, only a feast like this can do them justice.
A harvest feast packed to the brim! One bite and you're good to go!
A dish that brings out a refreshingly sweet and tangy flavor by cooking sugary snowy cantaloupe with fish.
A beloved dish among the people of Hexia. Each ingredient holds a heartfelt meaning.
A delicate wrap of rice and tender fish meat that offers complete satisfaction in a single bite.
A satisfying dish made with generous portions of ingredients that's sure to leave you both content and craving for more!
A fish steamed with crystal-like premium grains, sparkling with the vibrant energy of naturally grown food.
A simple tea brewed from common fruits. Washes away all traces of fatigue.
A steamed seafood dish with crabs and shellfish, presented as if the crustaceans are breathing in the tides.
A fish soup made with bamboo shoots and tender fish. The fish is completely infused with the bamboo's flavorful fragrance.
A simple fish soup enriched by the taste of fresh seasonal catch. It is a proud testament to the fishermen's skills.
This seafood congee is so incredibly tasty, it'll make your eyebrows fall off.
A fried dish made with rainbow mantis shrimp and fish. It's said that the shrimp hops all over the fish in the pot.
A crispy mix of fried phoenix barb and mushrooms. So tasty it's hard to tell which one steals the show.

This color helps it blend seamlessly with the mud hole.

This dish is incredible! Let me finish it first, then I'll tell you just how amazing it is!
An ordinary plum dropped from a tree. Eating it will restore some strength.
An ordinary apple dropped from a tree. Eating it will restore some strength.

A common scarecrow that can watch over fields and monitor the growth of crops.

An ordinary avocado dropped from a tree. Eating it will restore some strength.

Brilliant in color, it prefers sunlight where its green bands gleam the most.
Hinge but not cringe, this shrimp gets downnnn.
It looks like a burger, but is even tastier.
Ferocious, though only when it's in the water.
When it flickers with bioluminescence at high frequency, it might be quarreling with its companions.
It's gentle-natured but has a habit of gnawing on coral.
They are beauty, they are grace. They prefer a quieter place.
It looks delicious, but actually isn't.
Beautiful, and delicious too.
Plain at first glance, but a star in the pet market.

It only looks like an owl from a certain angle.
True to its name, it looks just like a grass rope.
It's even better at sneak attacks than an octopus.
It races with the tide just to reach its favorite seaweed.
It may bumble, but it's ever so gentle.
Compared to the northern snakehead, the dark snakehead seems to have a gentler temper.
This fish has so many blotches that it could start its own dot-com bubble.
It welcomes the venomous embrace of sea anemone sting cells, provided it's not molting.
A delicious baked fish dish refined after 198 experiments. The heat and timing have been perfected, ready for your enjoyment anytime, anywhere!
Bigger the size, stronger the punch.
Glamorous on one side, modest on the other.
The "map" on its body does not mark treasures with an X.
A strike from its <style=ItemHighlight>venomous</style> tail brings more than just pain.
Once grown, it no longer offers cleaning services for other fish.
To hatch it, you'll need both water and mud.
No need to follow traffic rules when you live in the water.
Compared to regular shrimp, it has a bigger body and a thicker vein.
The fiercest will delivers the greatest victories.
Timid by nature, yet fiercely territorial.
The bigger it grows, the more it craves fish.
It is considerably large, though only in the world of insects.
It runs faster than you'd ever expect.
It looks like an acraea, hence the name false acraea.
A cockle, and also a muse of art itself.
True to its name, it enjoys spreading its wings beneath the sun.
A big guy with a sweet tooth.
Before its value was discovered, it was just called "Deck Rot."
So colorful that... even its tongue is green.
Actually, cushion stars can also take on a square shape.
Highly <style=ItemHighlight>venomous</style>, so beware the sting.
Even as a juvenile, it can swallow other small fish whole.
